intro: Bouvardia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and red. Its leaves are narrow and glossy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Bouvardia angustifolia is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets due to its compact size and attractive blooms.
